msItem.author: Orosius
msItem.title: Historiarum aduersum paganos libri vii

rubric.hi: Incipit Epistola Pauli orosii presbiteri de ormęsta mundi contra acusatoręs cristianorum tęmporum scripta ad bęatum augustinum.

msItem.incipit: Praeceptis tuis parui beatissime pater augustine. atque utinam tam efficaciter quam libenter. quanquam ego in utramuis partem parum de explicito mouear˷ recte ne an secus egerim.
msItem.explicit: fol. 142rb Ita iam ego certo et solo quem concupiscere debui˷ obedientię meę fructu fruor. De qualitate autem opusculorum tu uideris⸵ quia praecepisti tibi adiudicanda si edas. per te iudicata si deleas.

finalRubric.hi: Explicit fol. 142va Liber Sęptimus Pauli Horosii Pręsbiteri Ad augustinum Episcopum Hystoriarum Contra Accusatoręs Tęmporum Cristianorum.

collation.signatures: Final page of each gathering numbered in ink, ·i· to ·xvij·, centred at the foot.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled in drypoint; pricking on outer edges of the pages. On fol. 19r, major horizontal rules, from top to bottom, occur at 22 | 54 | 250 | 265 | 331 mm; vertical rules, from left to right, at 20 | 88.5 | 96 | 103 | 170.5 | 219. Line spacing 6.5 mm. Written above top line.

handDesc.handNote: Protogothic, middle of the twelfth century. At least three scribes.

decoDesc.decoNote: New books open with large, intricately decorated initials. Fol. 3ra, epistle, 6-line golden P with green decoration; 3rb, prologue to book 1, 3-line green and red P with golden decoration; 4vb, book 1, 11-line M formed by animals, with silver underlay; 18va, prologue to book 2, 4-line blue N with red and golden decoration; 18vb, book 2, 3-line golden R; 31rb, prologue to book 3, 3-line golden E; 31va, book 3, 5-line red and green A with blue and golden decoration; 48rb, prologue to book 4, 4-line blue D with red decoration; 49ra, book 4, 5-line golden A; 68vb, prologue to book 5, 5-line green S with blue decoration; 70va, book 5, 5-line red A with blue decoration; 90ra, prologue to book 6, 5-line blue O with red decoration; 92ra, book 6, 7-line golden B; 111vb, prologue to book 7, plain 3-line red S; 113va, book 7, red and green I in the margin with red decoration. Chapters begin with enlarged red initials. Headings to books in red, usually with enlarged blue initial.

additions.p: A charter hand from the late twelfth or early thirteenth century adds in the margin the relative dates from the birth of Adam throughout the work, with an extended note on a discrepancy with Bede, De temporibus on fol. 135va. Many nota marks.
Dates in Arabic and Roman numerals pencilled next to some passages, as well as a note on the upper pastedown (s. xiii), L viº Dixit cristi agi (?).
Fol. 2v, Orosius de Ormesta Mundi (s. xvii).
Pressmarks: 24 (spine: s. xvi); I Arch 3-I. (white label on spine); MS. Jesus Coll. Ox. C. 62 (blue label on spine); 6, 2025, Numb. 6, (24) (fol. 1r); Num: 6 (fol. 2v).

binding.p: Romanesque, whittawed leather over wooden boards. Extended tab at the head of the spine, with blue and white stitching. Two leather strips function as bookmarks, sewn onto a larger leather thong.

history.origin: Written at Cirencester Abbey in the middle of the twelfth century. On fol. 1r, Liber Ecclesie Sancte Marie de Cyrencestr’. (s. xiv).
history.acquisition: Appears in the list of the books of John Prise (whose table of contents is on the front cover) in the 1602 donation willed to Jesus College by his son Gregory Prise (1535–1600). Neil R. Ker, ‘Sir John Prise’, The Library, 5th ser., 10, no. 1 (March 1955): 1–24.

listBibl.bibl: Graham Pollard, ‘The Construction of English Twelfth-Century Bindings’, The Library, 5th ser., 17, no. 1 (March 1962): 1–22 (at 16n4, pl. 2).
